dungeon.maptools

Class RoomBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • dungeon.maptools.RoomBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RoomBuilding

    public class RoomBuilder
extends Object
implements RoomBuilding
    Includes methods to build rooms by placing walls and floors. Also used to initialise the map.
    Author:
    tgtapio

    • Method Detail

      • initMap

        public int[][] initMap(int[][] map,
                       int height,
                       int width,
                       int roomAttempts)
        Initialises the map by filling it with empty space "1" and creates the outer walls "0". Initialises roomWalls int[][][] for storing the walls of each room. Sizes are amount of rooms (segments) = (5+attempts)*2 to cover all possible rooms and have plenty of room for separated corridor segments. y and x are equal to the size of the whole map, which is by default more than the size of the biggest possible room.
        Specified by:
        initMap in interface RoomBuilding
        Parameters:
        map - being worked on
        height - of the map, walls included
        width - of the map, walls included
        roomAttempts - number of room placement attempts
        Returns:
        map being worked on

      • addRoom

        public int[][] addRoom(int[][] map,
                       int rwidth,
                       int rheight)
        Attempts to place a room on the map by first creating a parameter sized room, then choosing random coordinates for it on the map. If it collides with another room or wall, the room is not placed. First iteration is to check each square for collision. This probably can be optimised later on. Also something to consider: should the room's starting location be fully random inside the map area, or limited so that it will always at least fit inside the outer walls. For now, going with the option to limit starting location so that the walls won't be a problem. This I think will be easier, though it means the slight change in how often addRoom will be able to fit the room in.
        Specified by:
        addRoom in interface RoomBuilding
        Parameters:
        map - being worked on
        rwidth - width of the room to be added
        rheight - height of the room to be added
        Returns:
        map being worked on

      • buildFloors

        public int[][] buildFloors(int[][] map,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           int rwidth,
                           int rheight)
        Numbers the floor squares, getting the room id from global roomCount variable. roomCount is incremented in the addRoom method, allowing this to be used in other context as well.
        Specified by:
        buildFloors in interface RoomBuilding
        Parameters:
        map - being worked on
        x - starting coordinate for the WALLS, floor begins at x+1, y+1
        y - starting coordinate for the WALLS, floor begins at x+1, y+1
        rwidth - of the room, INCLUDING walls
        rheight - of the room, INCLUDING walls
        Returns:
        map being worked on

      • buildWalls

        public int[][] buildWalls(int[][] map,
                          int x,
                          int y,
                          int rwidth,
                          int rheight)
        Builds walls for a room starting from coordinate x,y.
        Specified by:
        buildWalls in interface RoomBuilding
        Parameters:
        map - being worked on
        x - starting coordinate
        y - starting coordinate
        rwidth - width of the room, i.e. length of the x walls
        rheight - height of the room, i.e. length of the y walls
        Returns:
        map being worked on

      • storeWallCoordinates

        public void storeWallCoordinates(int x,
                                 int y,
                                 int roomId)
        Adds a coordinates and id of a room wall square into the roomWalls data structure (IndexOfLists).
        Specified by:
        storeWallCoordinates in interface RoomBuilding
        Parameters:

        y - coordinate of the wall
        roomId - id for the segment

      • emptySquare

        public boolean emptySquare(int[][] map,
                           int x,
                           int y)
        Checks to see if the square in the given coordinates is 'empty', i.e. 1. Returns true if square is empty, false if square is 'wall' (0), or belongs to another room (value is over 1).
        Specified by:
        emptySquare in interface RoomBuilding
        Parameters:
        map - being worked on
        x - coordinate
        y - coordinate
        Returns:
        true if square is free

      • getRoomCount

        public int getRoomCount()
        Mostly for convenience, useful for reports or analysis or just to avoid counting the rooms on the screen.
        Specified by:
        getRoomCount in interface RoomBuilding
        Returns:
        [amount of rooms in the map + 1]: empty map is 'room 1'
